intro: Loranthus novae-britanniae, commonly known as the New Britain mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on the branches of native Australian eucalyptus trees. It belongs to the Viscaceae family and has a distinctive appearance with small, oval-shaped leaves and white, fragrant flowers. The plant relies on its host for water and nutrients, while it provides nectar that attracts birds and insects. Its seeds are dispersed by birds that eat the fleshy, red berries. This species plays an important ecological role in its native habitat.
